body_html:
If I add "export USE_OPENCV=1" in bashrc, the cmake summary will indicates "USE_OPENCV: ON", but when I run command "python setup.py install", I will meet errors:
/home/xiongcx/pytorch/build/lib/libcaffe2_gpu.so: undefined reference to caffe2::DecodeMultipleClipsFromVideo(char const*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, int, caffe2::Params const&, int, int, bool, int&, int&, std::vector<unsigned char*, std::allocator<unsigned char*> >&)' /home/xiongcx/pytorch/build/lib/libcaffe2_gpu.so: undefined reference to caffe2::ClipTransformRGB(unsigned char const*, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int const*, int const*, bool, bool, float, float, float, bool, float, std::vector<std::vector<float, std::allocator >, std::allocator<std::vector<float, std::allocator > > > const&, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, std::mersenne_twister_engine<unsigned long, 32ul, 624ul, 397ul, 31ul, 2567483615ul, 11ul, 4294967295ul, 7ul, 2636928640ul, 15ul, 4022730752ul, 18ul, 1812433253ul>, float)'
/home/xiongcx/pytorch/build/lib/libcaffe2_gpu.so: undefined reference to `caffe2::ClipTransformOpticalFlow(unsigned char const*, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, cv::Rect_ const&, int, bool, int, int, int, bool, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, float*)'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
caffe2/CMakeFiles/event_test.dir/build.make:112: recipe for target 'bin/event_test' failed
make[2]: *** [bin/event_test] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:2613: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/event_test.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/event_test.dir/all] Error 2

If I use command "USE_OPENCV=1 python setup.py install", the cmake summary will indicates "USE_OPENCV: ON" too. But I will also meet the similiar error:
/home/xiongcx/pytorch/build/lib/libcaffe2_gpu.so: undefined reference to caffe2::DecodeMultipleClipsFromVideo(char const*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, int, caffe2::Params const&, int, int, bool, int&, int&, std::vector<unsigned char*, std::allocator<unsigned char*> >&)' /home/xiongcx/pytorch/build/lib/libcaffe2_gpu.so: undefined reference to caffe2::ClipTransformRGB(unsigned char const*, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, int const*, int const*, bool, bool, float, float, float, bool, float, std::vector<std::vector<float, std::allocator >, std::allocator<std::vector<float, std::allocator > > > const&, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, std::mersenne_twister_engine<unsigned long, 32ul, 624ul, 397ul, 31ul, 2567483615ul, 11ul, 4294967295ul, 7ul, 2636928640ul, 15ul, 4022730752ul, 18ul, 1812433253ul>, float)'
/home/xiongcx/pytorch/build/lib/libcaffe2_gpu.so: undefined reference to `caffe2::ClipTransformOpticalFlow(unsigned char const*, int, int, int, int, int, int, int, cv::Rect_ const&, int, bool, int, int, int, bool, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, std::vector<float, std::allocator > const&, float*)'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
caffe2/CMakeFiles/common_test.dir/build.make:112: recipe for target 'bin/common_test' failed
make[2]: *** [bin/common_test] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:2487: recipe for target 'caffe2/CMakeFiles/common_test.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [caffe2/CMakeFiles/common_test.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....

@deepali-c Thanks for your attention. Do you have any other ideas?

If I add "export USE_OPENCV=1" in bashrc, the cmake summary will indicates "USE_OPENCV: ON", but  when I run command "python setup.py install", I will meet errors:
/home/xiongcx/pytorch/build/lib/libcaffe2_gpu.so: undefined reference to `caffe2::DecodeMultipleClipsFromVideo(char const*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> > const&, int, caffe2::Params const&, int, int, bool, int&, int&, std::vector<unsigned char*, std::allocator<unsigned char*> >&)'
